publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2774 Michael Russell: Congratulations to Alain Baxter—That the Parliament congratulates Alain Baxter on winning the bronze medal in the men’s slalom at the Winter Olympic Games, becoming the first Scottish skier to win a medal in such a competition; expresses support for his wish to declare his Scottishness publicly and visibly at the Games, and demands that the British Olympic Committee withdraws its objection, made in contravention of the Olympic Charter, to displays of the Scottish national flag by Scottish athletes.
S1M-2774 Congratulations to Alain Baxter (lodged on 25 February 2002) Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Stewart Stevenson*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*
S1M-2774 Congratulations to Alain Baxter (lodged on 25 February 2002) Donald Gorrie*, Alex Neil*
S1M-2774 Congratulations to Alain Baxter (lodged on 25 February 2002) Michael Matheson*

S1M-2774 Michael Russell: Congratulations to Alain Baxter-That the Parliament congratulates Alain Baxter on winning the bronze medal in the men's slalom at the Winter Olympic Games, becoming the first Scottish skier to win a medal in such a competition; expresses support for his wish to declare his Scottishness publicly and visibly at the Games, and demands that the British Olympic Committee withdraws its objection, made in contravention of the Olympic Charter, to displays of the Scottish national flag by Scottish athletes. Supported by: Mrs Margaret Ewing, Stewart Stevenson, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Donald Gorrie, Alex Neil, Michael Matheson
S1M-2774 Congratulations to Alain Baxter (lodged on 25 February 2002) Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Shona Robison*
S1M-2774 Congratulations to Alain Baxter (lodged on 25 February 2002) Linda Fabiani*, Christine Grahame*, Fiona Hyslop*
S1M-2774 Congratulations to Alain Baxter (lodged on 25 February 2002) Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-2774 Congratulations to Alain Baxter (lodged on 25 February 2002) Mr Duncan Hamilton*
S1M-2774 Congratulations to Alain Baxter (lodged on 25 February 2002) Irene McGugan*
S1M-2774 Congratulations to Alain Baxter (lodged on 25 February 2002) Ms Sandra White*
